title: Cabbage And Collards
summary: The recipe Cabbage And Collards could satisfy your Southern craving in approximately 45 minutes. One serving contains 193 calories, 7g of protein, and 13g of fat. This recipe serves 8. For 84 cents per serving, this recipe covers 21% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. A couple people made this recipe, and 41 would say it hit the spot. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and whole 30 diet. It works well as a side dish. A mixture of onion, cabbage, canolan oil, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. With a spoonacular score of 85%, this dish is excellent. Try Collards and Kimchi, Carbonnade with Collards, and Cajun Collards for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Southern works really well with Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. One wine you could try is Weingut Darting Durkheimer Nonnengarten Riesling Kabinett (1 Liter). It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 18 dollars.

productMatches.title: Weingut Darting Durkheimer Nonnengarten Riesling Kabinett (1 Liter)
productMatches.description: Durkheimer Hochbenn Kabinett Riesling is a rich and sultry wine. There's a slight surmise of botrytis, and a few nubby tannins, but the overall effect is sold and firm
